meanings.definition: To make a series of soft explosive sounds
meanings.sent1: The old car engine was sputtering as it struggled to start.
meanings.sent2: The campfire was sputtering, sending sparks into the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The sputtering toaster made breakfast time more exciting.
meanings.sent4: His sputtering attempt at beatboxing left everyone laughing.
meanings.sent5: The sputtering fireworks lit up the dark sky with bursts of light.

meanings.definition: To speak in a hesitant or incoherent manner
meanings.sent1: She was sputtering with nervousness during her speech.
meanings.sent2: The tired professor was sputtering through his lecture.
meanings.sent3: His sputtering excuse for being late was hard to believe.
meanings.sent4: The politician's sputtering response failed to convince the audience.
meanings.sent5: The child was sputtering with excitement as he told his story.

meanings.definition: To emit particles or sparks in a scattered manner
meanings.sent1: The welding machine was sputtering as it joined the metal pieces.
meanings.sent2: The bonfire was sputtering, sending embers flying around.
meanings.sent3: The faulty wire was sputtering dangerous sparks.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks were sputtering in all directions, creating a dazzling display.
meanings.sent5: The fireplace was sputtering, filling the room with warmth and light.
